intro: Narcissus biancae, commonly known as the white narcissus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its elegant, cup-shaped flowers that are predominantly white with a subtle yellowish hue at the base. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, featuring narrow, strap-like leaves that emerge from a basal rosette. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Its delicate appearance makes it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens.
